title: DIONIS: Efficient monitoring system for vineyards

author: Liljana Gavrilovska, Faculty of Electrical Engineering and Information Technologies, St. Cyril and Methodius University in Skopje

segmentation: Well, as you know, I came from faculty of Electrical Engineering from Macedonia from Scorpion and I will present you today.
Our joint work with the company from Skopia Euro computer systems.
We found a joint interest in implementation of the sensors in a Vine yard and our proposal.
Our project, we called ionics efficient monitoring system for.
In the arts.
How?
What is the rationale behind actually the idea of implementation of sensor networks?
Somewhere, somehow, was raised from the process project.
We are partners in the process project and this is the result of it.

The rationale behind why did we switch a little bit from the major topic within the project is the reasons that in Macedonia we have at the moment pick focus on agriculture from one side and from the other side.
It's a lot of available European funds that we can apply for.
And maybe get some money to implement our ideas.
So at the moment, in Macedonia we have around 27,000 more, a little bit more hectares of vineyards.
It's a big production.
We have 88 binaries, 65% of these resources are belongs to the wineries vinery production and it is a big focus on the binary production within the agriculture area as well.
So we had the winery forum who booty who supported different the research and application and we really think that we will find the funds to realize our project.
Also, Macedonia has is a well known winery region.
We have some specific binary types and grape types, and in the last several years we have a growing up production.

And the decrease and reduce the use of the pesticide producing healthier grade.
Reduce the use of water will somehow result in a green environment because to pump the water it takes.
Some energy to support our dear.
We were doing some search in the world and come to the lot of successful stories in the vineyards around the world.
From California to India, South Africa, Spain and so on.
It's a lot of facts that really shows up that integration, capacity, technology and agricultural knowledge and implementation of this combination to the real world is really beneficiary.
So we will.
We will go into the facts for why winery that's the camel divine, the art in California.

They have involved the sensor monitoring.

And a few years after they have involved the specific sensor monitoring but or different different parameters specified for different wine sorts and we can see from the numbers that from the left from the left column here we can see from the numbers that the production of the group of the crop in total growth.
That's the 1st result, but from the other site in the in the second column we can see.
Of course their variation depending on the year, but also the limitation of the water consumption.
So this is a.
Really benefit of it because it is the water is very expensive resource from one side, but from the other side it will spend less energy to.
To provide this water to the wind yard.
So we come to the idea.
Love for with lessons learned.
After this search we come to the idea maybe to use the momentum and to propose a project or to propose implementation of sensor networks in the Vine Yard monitoring.
So we define the project called Distributed Intelligence System for monitoring Vine yards with sensor networks.
Within this system we have designed the type of sensors that type of transceivers which.
Allow communication data center.
The type of buzzer collection organizing update Baza user interfaces and complete the sensor system which will do the observation and monitoring visualization system which is B.
Which is actually mentioned meant to the users how to monitor the data and the large systems who is also meant somehow to prevent a specific specific situation.
Our conclusion is that this will.
Delta quality of the group and a better production of the Office of The of the Grape.
Our sensor network is for you.
Is consists of different type of sensors for different parameters monitoring.
So we have grouped them in several groups.
Interrogation optimization for irrigation optimization like soil moister, softap, rainfall and temperature, humidity and so on.
Disease prevention like leaf witnesses, UV radiation, some number of sunflowers, wind speed and so on.
Drought and Frost prediction.
Also it could be temperature.
Humidity and soil quality.
Different elements like like Asset, Force four and so on, which are important for different type of grapes so far as well, chemical composition of the soil.
Family reaction of some changes and so on.
So our visualization system will be based on the web publication and we still allow the remote Vine yard monitoring.

To the to the Summer Control Center or to the particular person if it's necessary via.
Email via SMS message and so on.
So how does it our implementation looks.
